intro: Hygrophila urquiolae, commonly known as the Ecuadorian hygrophila, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Ecuador, and thrives in moist, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
